alert.note: Alert for Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 2:17AM MDT until October 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FAR SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHEAST WYOMING...THE BLACK HILLS...AND THE REST OF SOUTHERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Today will be warm and dry across much of the area as a warm front lifts slowly north across northeast Wyoming, the Black Hills, and southern South Dakota. Southwesterly winds will become quite gusty near and to the south of the boundary in the afternoon, with humidity values dropping into the teens. Combined with dry fuels, this will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 315 AND 317... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 315 Southern Campbell and 317 Weston County Plains. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 30 mph, with gusts up to 50 mph across southern Campbell County. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
